intro: Zanthoxylum dellomei, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its spiny branches and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. Its bark and leaves contain compounds used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Zanthoxylum dellomei thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry, rocky soils.
